Message.Msg: If IBM drops to $180 then I would not be a buyer. IBM is expected to earn $5.25, and I am sure they will meet/beat that number. However, if the revenue numbers continue to trend in reverse the stock will sell off. I would say the CFO has some integrity at stake with this report based on his statements on the last conference call. Are some of the smaller firms taking market share from IBM? Is the "big data pie" not as big as first thought? ORCL, SAP, and ACN seem to be doing well. I expect the same from IBM.
With todays downturn in IBM during an up market one wonders what is the current driving force. Cramer is positive. Is that the kiss of death
Somebody is watching too much television...

Message.Title: IBM needs over 32 Billion in rev in Q4 to beat last years rev of 106 billion
Message.Msg: who thinks this is going to happen, They would need the best qtr ever, with FC there is no way that it can happen, if it does then 200 a share easy, more likely 28-29 billion 180 for sure

Topic.Title: IBM needs over 32 Billion in rev in Q4 to beat last years rev of 106 billion

Message.Msg: IBM will report around $29 billion in revenues this quarter. If they report over $30 billion in revenues the stock will quickly trade over $200. I believe most expect a drop in revenues and decelerating revenues going forward. That is why an upside surprise will propel the stock price. A roadmap to $20 per share will be viewed as a meaningless achievement if done so with decelerating revenues. The multiple will compress and we may see sideways action for years? If the multiple drop to 9 or 10 what will we get...

Message.Title: Has IBM been up more than one day this year?
A "miss' is baked into the stock price
Message.Msg: in previous times leading up to 'the announcement' , IBM would gain in price right up to the day of this "miss". Its different now as the "investors" are taking money off the table, money that they might not recover in future quarters.
I hope so, it has been down five days in a row.

Topic.Title: IBM needs over 32 Billion in rev in Q4 to beat last years rev of 106 billion

Message.Msg: cvs9yt blurts out: "who thinks this is going to happen, They would need the best qtr ever, with FC there is no way that it can happen, if it does then 200 a share easy, more likely 28-29 billion 180 for sure" There you go again -- making up a straw men to knock down. "who thinks this is going to happen"? Nobody -- none of the 22 analysts who follow IBM as the highest Q4 estimate is currently $29.9 bil -- the average is $29.16 bil. I don't know how you were wronged by Big Blue but you have a fetish. Your posts are amusing.

Message.Title: MACD MACD MACD
Message.Msg: oh boy oh boy oh boy pizza time

Topic.Title: 2 Things We All Know Obama Hates: "Colonialism"... and "Capitalism".

Message.Msg: ... which currently, is the highest corporate tax rate in the industrialized world. That's not low, "bub". If you invest $10,000 in a stock and it rises to $10,300 in one year during which the inflation rate is 3%, what is the capital gains tax rate on that $300 gain in "real" terms? Answer: 100%. That's not low, "bub". A proposal to "index" capital gains for inflation after Obama took office was floated out of Washington in an ocean of entitlements... we index earned income for inflation... but we certainly don't want to do anything to help people who invest in jobs-producing industry, now do we. S
